alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 1:40PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Laramie County through 215 PM MDT... At 140 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Iron Mountain, or 25 miles northeast of Laramie, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Iron Mountain. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County
